Key Match Events: DeMar DeRozan hit three shots, the third an 18-footer that opened up a five-point lead with just 12.8 seconds to play in the second overtime.
Domantas Sabonis put up a triple-double for the Kings with 21 points, a game-high 18 rebounds and a game-high 11 assists.
Post-Match Reflections: DeMar DeRozan expressed his relief in helping the Kings win after the double overtime thriller.
Interim coach Doug Christie emphasized the importance of the fifth straight win under his leadership.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings were playing without the injured De'Aaron Fox (glute).
The Heat were led by Tyler Herro (26 points) without Jimmy Butler (suspension).
Others: Jaime Jaquez Jr. notched a triple-double of his own with a team-high 10 assists and 12 rebounds for the Heat.
The game was played on the front end of a back-to-back for the Heat.
